p: RSV is the major pathogen implicated in acute bronchiolitis in infants up to 1Â year and is responsible for a great number of hospitalizations and deaths in this age group. In the second year of life, RV and HBoV become more frequent pathogens ( Jartti et al., 2019). Host immune response skewed towards type 2 cytokine production seems to play a central role in the pathogenesis of the disease. Bronchiolitis is further associated with recurrent wheezing.
